title: What type of music do you listen to? What do you enjoy about it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Although my stock answer to “What kind of music do you like?” really is “Everything,” with no genres excluded, it doesn’t mean I don’t have preferences. If I’m not limited by genre, here is how I determine what I most like to hear in music: High and/or variable volumeMid-tempo to fast tempoSyncopated, complex rhythmic pattern (I don’t care what meter(s) it’s in, as long as it’s done convincingly, and with a logical pattern for the piece)Expansive melody in at least one part of a piece, enough to turn my head - i.e. wide intervals, strategic use of melodic motif manipulation, sequence and variation, or something utterly strangeVocals with excellent breath support, in any style - growling, clean, with vibrato or without, raspy and harsh, doesn’t matter. Just as long as the vocals are bold, even when the vocalist occasionally sings softly for emotionality.Vocal harmonies, though I recognize that they’re not appropriate everywhere. But solid, compatible vocal harmonies. Think Fleetwood Mac, The Temptations, Georgia Mass Choir, The Pointer Sisters, or Pain of Salvation (the first six albums).Distortion. On guitars, on basses, on organs, just distortion on all of the amplified instruments. But not all the time.Deep, heavy, bold bass.Dramatic string, woodwind, choral, and brass arrangements.Creative use of found, orchestral, or any culture’s traditional percussion.Use of instruments from mixed cultures (but done tastefully, not in a way that smacks of cultural appropriation)Dissonance (but not all the time). I like my dissonance with a liberal dose of consonance, rather than consonance with a light dose of dissonance.Use of fugue, canticle, round, variation, and other potentially layered polyphony.Surprise.Cavernous reverb and big sound.Musical references and musical humor (using melody, harmony, and rhythm to make cultural reference jokes).Musical illustrations of lyrics (literal interpretations).Anticipation and delayed attack. The very heart of funk.Synthesizers and electronic beats (but the biggest sounds possible).As for why I like these things, I’ve determined that it’s because of my overall sensory sensitivity. My senses are either heightened or lowered in comparison to other people, but when it comes to my hearing, I hear in color. I mean that quite literally; I have synesthesia. And I don’t just hear in color. I hear in pictures, movies, stories, physical sensations. The word frisson comes to mind. The more is happening sonically, the more I see and feel, and the more I am capable of feeling emotion, in turn. I am a sensation-seeker. Sometimes, seeking these stronger sensations can help distract me from other distressing sensations I’m experiencing. Or sometimes they keep my mind from stumbling over itself in a loop, or going off in a million directions. Music keeps me focused - on the music, at least. On that one, maybe two to five things, rather than thirty things. Rather than obsessing or worrying or whatever it was I was going to do instead. As far as genres, if you still want that answer: should follow that my default favorite genres are metal, rock, country, hip-hop, dance/EDM, and house techno, based on the list above. That’s extremely general, and leaves out every other genre in which there are things I love, but those genres tend to combine most of the aesthetics I’m seeking all in one place.

Music is my absolute passion along with books & film, but if I was to choose one out of the three it would have to be music. I pretty much listen to alll different kinds of music which ranges from rock to classical and I go through stages listening to different types of bands of all genres sometimes for months at a time like I just went the last few months listening to The Stones & now I’m going through a Radiohead phase & maybe next it’ll be something completely different like reggae, Marley, Peter Tosh, Augustus Pablo, Lee Perry, or an electronic phase, The Orb, Kraftwerk, Massive Attack, or an alternative phase, My Bloody Valentine, The Pixies, Dinosaur Jnr, Spacemen 3/Spiritualised, Galaxy 500, Sonic Youth, Primal Scream or maybe something from the 60’s/70’s like The Beatles(my all time favourite band, I’m from Liverpool so it has to be) or The Who, The Stones, Zeppelin, Floyd, Hendrix, Dylan etc, & how about some cool sounding soul & funk from the likes of Marvin Gaye or The Family stone or Curtis Mayfield & Prince, Funkadelic. Music resonates with something deep within my very essence that just makes me feel alive & that’s why it’s my absolute passion. I can’t think of anything better than to seethe back at the start of a really great album & to prepare to experience something truly wonderful & special.

Motown, Pointer Sisters, Most Holland, Dozier, Holland written songs and the 4 Tops, Supremes. Temptations, Smokey Robinson and the Miracles, the Shirelles, the Marvelettes, Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, Bruce Springsteen, Bob Seger, CCR, the Eagles, the Beatles, Fleetwood Mac and Rod Stewart. Doo Wop songs of the fifties and sixties like Johnny Maestro and the Crests, the Chantels, the Monotones, the Elegants, Betty Everett, the Chiffons, the Exciters, the Shangri-las, Martha and the Vandellas, Dee Dee Sharp, the Crystals, the Angels, Marcy Blaine and many more. I also like country from the past like Johnny Cash, Merle Haggard, George Jones, the Everly Brothers, Tammy Wynette, George Strait, Alan Jackson, Alabama, the Judds, Buck Owens, Brooks and Dunn, Glen Campbell, Patsy Cline, Hank Williams and Hank Williams Jr., Tanya Tucker. Loretta Lynn, Dolly Parton and many more. I have enjoyed this music since the late fifties.

SLAAAAAAAAAAAYERRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR!! So, i enjoy all kinds of music, the ones that are soothing to my ears at least. But the genre i prefer the most, are METAL, and EDM. Why? because those are the ones that resonate with me more than any other. Why? because Metal got me through tough times and made me have a better understanding on certain things. My perspective on things changed. Also also, it kind of in a way made me more intimidating. I’ve been in the metal scene since i was 8, i am now 30. Back in the days, at that time, at the school i was in, i was the only Metalhead. I was that weird kid, always dressed in black, talking to no one, in his own dark little world. Of course, people were intimidated by that. In other words, no one tried to fuck with me. So yeah, being a Metalhead has its perks. Of course people would shout things and say things and make rumors, but touch me? wouldn’t fucking dare.

NWOFHM (new wave of finnish heavy metal) Power metal Symphonic metal I love all kinds of metal but these are the genres I'm currently most into. I love the exceptional female leads, the power metal chord progressions and the instrumentation of Symphonic metal. So epic. I really enjoy musical theater and with these genres it's like watching a piece from a musical but metalized. Some of it's pretty sappy but I'm pretty sappy so it resonates with me.

At the moment I listen to a lot of film scores but I do enjoy all types of music pretty much. I just love music and I think what interests me about film scores is the harmony and the structure and the melodies. I also like how the composer has written it. I mean I wanna know exactly what software they use and how they've composed it because I really want to compose like them in

I listen to R&B a lot and it’s because I grew up with it. I listened to Usher, Sisqo, Tank, Ginuwine, Jaheim, Tyrese, Bobby V, Pretty Ricky, Omarion. It sounds so good with the various melodies and synths they put in. It’s a genre I can relate to. Currently I’m listening to more R&B singers this time around and it’s interesting to have unique vocalists come out and show what they got.

Older music (late 20th century). Queen, Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin, Nirvana, Billy Joel, David Bowie, Beatles, Rolling Stones, Alice In Chains, way too many to list here. I don’t really know why I like it so much. My dad likes a lot of older music too so I just assume those genes got passed down to me.
I enjoy relaxing music especially because it makes me see the world around differently, to focus on simple things in our life and feel yourself in the present moment.
Rock and hip hop and rap
